cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 110 miles east of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move northward along the Southeast U.S. coast, then turn north-northeast and accelerate parallel to the Mid-Atlantic shoreline, passing offshore of New Jersey before heading toward Atlantic Canada.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Outer Banks area of North Carolina

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from the North Carolina/Virginia border to Chincoteague VA, including Chesapeake Bay south of Smith Point
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from north of Savannah River to Surf City NC; Storm Surge Warning Jupiter Inlet FL to Surf City NC; Tropical Storm Warning Jupiter Inlet FL to Savannah River and Grand Bahama/Abacos Islands
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast through Georgia and the Carolinas, with effects spreading northward to the Mid-Atlantic and New England coasts
weather_observation.wind: Gusty northeast winds could reach 25–35 kt (below tropical-storm force most of the time) late Friday into Saturday as Dorian passes offshore.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible as outer rain-bands brush the region.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along New Jersey beaches may impact port maritime operations.
